message.content:
cs.CV, cs.RO, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM

The paper presents a deep learning-based system for localization of endoscopic capsule robots using visual information captured by a mono camera. This involves computer vision (CV) techniques for image processing and analysis, as well as robotics (RO) for the localization of the robot. The system uses a deep convolutional neural network (CNN) for real-time estimation of the robot's pose, which falls under machine learning (LG) and artificial intelligence (AI). The dataset used for evaluation was recorded inside a surgical human stomach model, which involves multimedia (MM) techniques for capturing and processing the images. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV, followed by cs.RO, cs.LG, cs.AI, and cs.MM.
